body: to clarify, AutoGMM does everything that GaussianCluster does and more. The difference is, GaussianCluster has an option to run kmeans initialization multiple times, which I have found empirically can lead to better results than any of the AutoGMM initializations. If AutoGMM had a way of running multiple kmeans inits and taking the best, we could deprecate GaussianCluster

rename.to: merge Autogmm and GaussianCluster, PR to sklearn

issue.title: Use GridSearch for GClust/KClust internals rather than having our own stuff
issue.body:
Right now, we use the param grid, but rather than passing to grid search we have all of that extra code just to select the best on some metric. I propose we just use `GridSearchCV`, I know how to hack it to ignore cross-validation and I have to do that anyway for some of my model selection code.

@j1c ?

rename.from: merge Autogmm and GaussianCluster, PR to sklearn

issue.title: Adding different model selection criteria for GMM
issue.body:
## Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
Currently, GMM returns the model that maximizes BIC. Sometimes it is desirable to have more expensive (i.e. more parameters) models. In these cases, less harsh parameter penalties should be used (i.e. AIC where the penalty is not a function of the number of parameters in the model).

## Describe the solution you'd like
Adding an keyword argument `penalty` (or something) to GMM fit function with BIC, AIC, etc as options and BIC as the default.

## Describe alternatives you've considered
None.

## Provide references (if applicable)
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Akaike_information_criterion

## Additional context
None.

body:
@bdpedigo I will take this one, sounds fun! : )

DoD:

- Implementation:
   - Add option in AutoGMM class to run k-means multiple times:
     - Must be simple and intuitive to call for the user
     - Must be able to specify min_components and max_components to use
            - If max_components is None then it must utilize min_components as maximum number(analogously to gclust)
     - Must be integrated with the k-means method already present in the AutoGMM class
- Testing:
    - Must have identical output as gclust. Meaning that the difference between number of clusters assigned by gclust and the merged functionality to autoGMM must be identically 0 given same input data and same settings

This is an initial very much qualitative assesment of what the final implementation should do. I am sure it will progressively become more and more quantitative. 

Please let me know if you have any suggestions/ideas.
